titleStmt.title: By the Queene. Where in the parliament holden at Westminster, ... there was for the reliefe of diuers poore decayed townes, [and] of great multitudes of her poor subiectes, who otherwise were likely to perishe, or to become vnprofitable and daungerous to the common weale, among other prouided and established, one good and beneficial statute, entituled, an acte for the continuaunce of makyng of cappes
Proclamations. 1573-04-27
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)

publicationStmt.publisher: In Powles Churcheyarde by Richard Iugge, printer to the Queenes Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: Last complete line of text ends: "offen-".
Requiring the poor to make hats.--STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
